ai-atk-s0401a16:1_1: that is to say, those who dwell in the wilderness,
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_3: Given that is the wilderness, one who gets material possessions and honor, and is not able to get material possessions.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_4: For a wilderness monk thinks, “I will live in the wilderness, the wilderness, and how wicked monks brings them to practice accordingly.” Then he doesn’t honor, respect, revere, worship, and venerate the mendicants.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_6: “Mendicants, this is definitely something worth having, that is, living in the wilderness.”
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_7: The same method applies in the same way.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_8: But there are many people here who are well developed and cultivated here,
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_9: Then remembering, “The Realised One’s going forth, long standing, longing for seven years.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_10: being well-prepared: the robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_12: clansman Kosambī is developing the Kosambī’s state.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_14: who speaks well of good conduct, who is speaking ill of the word of the bird.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_15: having good health, he has attained the attainment of health.
ai-atk-s0401a16:1_16: For a mendicant who practices the corpse of their own bodily particular individual essences, and gets material possessions to them.
ai-atk-s0401a16:2_0: The sixteenth section on the teaching is finished.
